greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = number of primitive (period n) n-bead bracelet structures using exactly k different colored beads.
comment: Turning over will not create a new bracelet. Permuting the colors of the beads will not change the structure.
reference: M. R. Nester (1999). Mathematical investigations of some plant interaction designs. PhD Thesis. University of Queensland, Brisbane, Australia. [See A056391 for pdf file of Chap. 2]
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275
formula: T(n, k) = Sum_{d|n} mu(n/d) * A152176(d, k).
program: (PARI) \\ Ach is A304972 and R is A152175 as square matrices.
Ach(n)={my(M=matrix(n, n, i, k, i>=k)); for(i=3, n, for(k=2, n, M[i, k]=k*M[i-2, k] + M[i-2, k-1] + if(k>2, M[i-2, k-2]))); M}
R(n)={Mat(Col([Vecrev(p/y, n) | p<-Vec(intformal(sum(m=1, n, eulerphi(m) * subst(serlaplace(-1 + exp(sumdiv(m, d, y^d*(exp(d*x + O(x*x^(n\m)))-1)/d))), x, x^m))/x))]))}
xref: Partial row sums include A000046, A056362, A056363, A056364, A056365.
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Apr 09 2017
